public abstract class BaseImageServer
extends BaseMapDataset
implements ImageServer

Provides basic implementation of ImageServer.

Field Detail

DEFAULT_CACHE_LIMIT

public static final int DEFAULT_CACHE_LIMIT
this is the default number of images stored into Cache, currently this value is 5

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

BaseImageServer

public BaseImageServer(ImageLayerSource source,
                       String mapName)
Constructs a new ImageServer for use with the specified ImageServerLayer. All images retrieved are placed in a Cache. This constructor sets the cache size to the DEFAULT_CACHE_LIMIT.

Parameters:
source - the ImageLayerSource that created this ImageServer
mapName - the Map Name

BaseImageServer

public BaseImageServer(ImageLayerSource source,
                       String name,
                       int cacheLimit)
Constructs a new ImageServer with specified limit to the number of map images that are stored in cache. Since the Images are cached in memory, the cache size should be chosen small to prevent resource overloading. The cacheLimit may be set to zero, in which case no image caching is provided. Attempting to set a negative cacheLimit causes the default to be chosen instead.

Parameters:
cacheLimit - the maximum number of images stored in cache
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name or layer are null
See Also:
BaseImageServer(ImageLayerSource, String)

setImageLayerSource

public void setImageLayerSource(ImageLayerSource source)
Description copied from interface: ImageServer
Sets the ImageLayerSource that is associated with this ImageServer. You might want to use this if you were planning to re-design an existing ImageLayerSource, and you want to add functionality to the getImageURL() method

Specified by:
setImageLayerSource in interface ImageServer
Parameters:
source - the ImageLayerSource
See Also:
ImageServer.setImageLayerSource(com.esri.mo2.map.img.ImageLayerSource)

searchDirect

public Cursor searchDirect(QueryFilter query)
Searches the server directly for an image using the given query. The query must be a BaseMapImageFilter, otherwise an empty cursor is returned

Returns:
a Cursor containing a single ServerImage, or empty cursor if query has wrong type.

retrieve

public void retrieve(Tile tile)
The specified Tile is expected to be a "candidate" Image, that is to be retrieved from the ImageServer, and then loaded. This method "blocks" until the Image is completely loaded, or an error occurs.

Specified by:
retrieve in interface ImageServer
Parameters:
tile - the cache tile that should be given the retrieved data
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if tile is not a com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Image
See Also:
ImageServer.retrieve(com.esri.mo2.map.img.Tile)
